item.title: Angspendlove add a quote by Robert Fulghum
item.description: "We’re all a little weird. And life is a little weird. And when we find someone whose weirdness is compatible with ours, we join up with them and fall into mutually satisfying weirdness—and call it love—true love." -- Robert Fulghum

item.title: Angspendlove add a quote by Gore Vidal
item.description: "There is no human problem which could not be solved if people would simply do as I advise." -- Gore Vidal

item.title: Angspendlove add a quote by Arbinger Institute
item.description: "There is a question I have learned to ask myself when I am feeling bothered about others: am I holding myself to the same standard I am demanding of them?" -- Arbinger Institute

item.title: Angspendlove add a quote by Elizabeth Taylor
item.description: "The problem with people who have no vices is that generally you can be pretty sure they're going to have some pretty annoying virtues." -- Elizabeth Taylor

item.title: Angspendlove add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "Daisy looked up at him with the kind of expression that Jesus might have given someone who had just explained that he was probably allergic to bread and fishes, so could He possibly do him a quick chicken salad..." -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Angspendlove add a quote by Arbinger Institute
item.description: "Most wars between individuals are of the 'cold' rather than the 'hot' variety---lingering resentment, for example, grudges long held, resources clutched rather than shared, help not offered. These are the acts of war that most threaten our homes and workplaces." -- Arbinger Institute

item.title: Angspendlove add a quote by Neil Gaiman
Angspendlove add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "I am remarkably likeable. Few people have ever been as likeable as I am. There is, frankly, no end to my likeability. People gather together in public assemblies to discuss how much they like me. I have several awards, and a small medal from a small country in South America which pays tribute both to how much I am liked and my general all around wonderfulness. I don't have it on me, of course. I keep my medals in my sock drawer." -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Angspendlove add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description:
"He was having more fun than a barrelful of monkeys.*
*Several years earlier Spider had actually been tremendously disappointed by a barrelful of monkeys. It had done nothing he had considered particularly entertaining, apart from emit interesting noises, and eventually, once the noises had stopped and the monkeys were no longer doing anything at all—except possibly on an organic level—had needed to be disposed of in the dead of night." -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Angspendlove add a quote by Charles Duhigg
item.description: "Change might not be fast and it isn't always easy. But with time and effort, almost any habit can be reshaped." -- Charles Duhigg

item.title: Angspendlove add a quote by James L. Ferrell
item.description: "Being Mistreated is the most important condition of mortality, for eternity itself depends on how we view those who mistreat us." -- James L. Ferrell
